SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

ar.com.hjg.pngj
Class PngReader

java.lang.Object
  ar.com.hjg.pngj.PngReader

public class PngReader
extends java.lang.Object

Reads a PNG image, line by line.

The reading sequence is as follows:
1. At construction time, the header and IHDR chunk are read (basic image info)
2. Afterwards you can set some additional global options. Eg. setUnpackedMode(boolean), setCrcCheckDisabled().
3. Optional: If you call getMetadata() or getChunksLisk() before start reading the rows, all the chunks before IDAT are automatically loaded and available
4a. The rows are read onen by one of the readRowXXX methods: readRowInt(int), readRowByte(int), etc, in order, from 0 to nrows-1 (you can skip or repeat rows, but not go backwards)
4b. Alternatively, you can read all rows, or a subset, in a single call: readRowsInt(), readRowsByte() ,etc. In general this consumes more memory, but for interlaced images this is equally efficient, and more so if reading a small subset of rows.
5. Read of the last row auyomatically loads the trailing chunks, and ends the reader.
6. end() forcibly finishes/aborts the reading and closes the stream

Constructs a PngReader from an InputStream.

See also FileHelper.createPngReader(File f) if available. Reads only the signature and first chunk (IDHR)

Parameters:
filenameOrDescription - : Optional, can be a filename or a description. Just for error/debug messages
Method Detail

end

public void end()
Normally this does nothing, but it can be used to force a premature closing. Its recommended practice to call it after reading the image pixels.

getChunkLoadBehaviour

See Also:
setChunkLoadBehaviour(ChunkLoadBehaviour)

getChunksList

public ChunksList getChunksList()
All loaded chunks (metada). If we have not yet end reading the image, this will include only the chunks before the pixels data (IDAT)

Critical chunks are included, except that all IDAT chunks appearance are replaced by a single dummy-marker IDAT chunk. These might be copied to the PngWriter

See Also:
getMetadata()

readRow

public ImageLine readRow(int nrow)
If called for first time, calls readRowInt. Elsewhere, it calls the appropiate readRowInt/readRowByte

In general, specifying the concrete readRowInt/readRowByte is preferrable

See Also:
{@link #readRowByte(int)}

readRow

public final int[] readRow(int[] buffer,
                           int nrow)
See Also:
readRowInt(int[], int)

readRowByte

public final byte[] readRowByte(byte[] buffer,
                                int nrow)
Reads a line and returns it as a byte[] array.

You can pass (optionally) a prealocatted buffer.

If the bitdepth is less than 8, the bytes are packed - unless unpackedMode is true.
If the bitdepth is 16, the least significant byte is lost.

Parameters:
buffer - Prealocated buffer, or null.
nrow - Row number (0 is top). Most be strictly greater than the last read row.
Returns:
The scanline in the same passwd buffer if it was allocated, a newly allocated one otherwise

readRowByte

public ImageLine readRowByte(int nrow)
Reads the row as BYTES, storing it in the imgLine property and returning it. The row must be greater or equal than the last read row. This method allows to pass the same row that was last read.

Parameters:
nrow - Row number, from 0 to rows-1. Increasing order.
Returns:
ImageLine object, also available as field. Data is in ImageLine.scanlineb (byte) field.

readRowInt

public ImageLine readRowInt(int nrow)
Reads the row as INT, storing it in the imgLine property and returning it. The row must be greater or equal than the last read row.

Parameters:
nrow - Row number, from 0 to rows-1. Increasing order.
Returns:
ImageLine object, also available as field. Data is in ImageLine.scanline (int) field.

readRowInt

public final int[] readRowInt(int[] buffer,
                              int nrow)
Reads a line and returns it as a int[] array.

You can pass (optionally) a prealocatted buffer.

If the bitdepth is less than 8, the bytes are packed - unless unpackedMode is true.

Parameters:
buffer - Prealocated buffer, or null.
nrow - Row number (0 is top). Most be strictly greater than the last read row.
Returns:
The scanline in the same passwd buffer if it was allocated, a newly allocated one otherwise

readRowsByte

public ImageLines readRowsByte()
Same as readRowsByte(0, imgInfo.rows, 1)

See Also:
readRowsByte(int, int, int)

readRowsByte

public ImageLines readRowsByte(int rowOffset,
                               int nRows,
                               int rowStep)
Reads a set of lines and returns it as a ImageLines object, which wrapas a byte[][] matrix. Internally it reads all lines, but decodes and stores only the wanted ones. This starts and ends the reading, and cannot be combined with other reading methods.

This it's more efficient (speed an memory) that doing calling readRowByte() for each desired line only if the image is interlaced.

Notice that the columns in the matrix is not the pixel width of the image, but rather pixels x channels

Parameters:
rowOffset - Number of rows to be skipped
nRows - Total number of rows to be read. -1: read all available
rowStep - Row increment. If 1, we read consecutive lines; if 2, we read even/odd lines, etc
Returns:
Set of lines as a matrix
See Also:
to read about the format of each row. Notice that if the bitdepth is 16 this will lose information

readRowsInt

public ImageLines readRowsInt()
Same as readRowsInt(0, imgInfo.rows, 1)

See Also:
readRowsInt(int, int, int)

readRowsInt

public ImageLines readRowsInt(int rowOffset,
                              int nRows,
                              int rowStep)
Reads a set of lines and returns it as a ImageLines object, which wraps matrix. Internally it reads all lines, but decodes and stores only the wanted ones. This starts and ends the reading, and cannot be combined with other reading methods.

This it's more efficient (speed an memory) that doing calling readRowInt() for each desired line only if the image is interlaced.

Notice that the columns in the matrix is not the pixel width of the image, but rather pixels x channels

Parameters:
rowOffset - Number of rows to be skipped
nRows - Total number of rows to be read. -1: read all available
rowStep - Row increment. If 1, we read consecutive lines; if 2, we read even/odd lines, etc
Returns:
Set of lines as a ImageLines, which wraps a matrix
See Also:
to read about the format of each row

readSkippingAllRows

public void readSkippingAllRows()
Reads all the (remaining) file, skipping the pixels data. This is much more efficient that calling readRow(), specially for big files (about 10 times faster!), because it doesn't even decompress the IDAT stream and disables CRC check Use this if you are not interested in reading pixels,only metadata.

setChunkLoadBehaviour

public void setChunkLoadBehaviour(ChunkLoadBehaviour chunkLoadBehaviour)
Determines which ancillary chunks (metada) are to be loaded

Parameters:
chunkLoadBehaviour - ChunkLoadBehaviour

setCrcCheckDisabled

public void setCrcCheckDisabled()
Disables the CRC integrity check in IDAT chunks and ancillary chunks, this gives a slight increase in reading speed for big files

setMaxBytesMetadata

public void setMaxBytesMetadata(int maxBytesChunksToLoad)
Set total maximum bytes to load from ancillary chunks (0: unlimited; default: 5Mb).
If exceeded, some chunks will be skipped

setMaxTotalBytesRead

public void setMaxTotalBytesRead(long maxTotalBytesToRead)
Set total maximum bytes to read (0: unlimited; default: 200MB).
These are the bytes read (not loaded) in the input stream. If exceeded, an exception will be thrown.

setShouldCloseStream

public void setShouldCloseStream(boolean shouldCloseStream)
if true, input stream will be closed after ending read

default=true

setSkipChunkIds

public void setSkipChunkIds(java.lang.String[] skipChunksById)
Chunks ids to be skipped.
These chunks will be skipped (the CRC will not be checked) and the chunk will be saved as a PngChunkSkipped object. See also setSkipChunkMaxSize

setSkipChunkMaxSize

public void setSkipChunkMaxSize(int skipChunksBySize)
Set maximum size in bytes for individual ancillary chunks (0: unlimited; default: 2MB).
Chunks exceeding this length will be skipped (the CRC will not be checked) and the chunk will be saved as a PngChunkSkipped object. See also setSkipChunkIds

setUnpackedMode

public void setUnpackedMode(boolean unPackedMode)
set/unset "unpackedMode"
If false (default) packed types (bitdepth=1,2 or 4) will keep several samples packed in one element (byte or int)
If true, samples will be unpacked on reading, and each element in the scanline will be sample. This implies more processing and memory, but it's the most efficient option if you intend to read individual pixels.
This option should only be set before start reading.

Parameters:
unPackedMode -

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Basic info, for debugging.
